required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Endometrial Pattern and Sub-endometrial Vascularity in ICSI Outcome
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Endometrial Pattern and Sub-endometrial Vascularity in Prediction of Pregnancy Rate in ICSI

brief_summary.textblock: Despite constant progress in in vitro fertilization (IVF) techniques and ovarian stimulation, pregnancy and embryo implantation rates remain modest . The phenomenon of embryo implantation depends both on the embryo itself and on endometrial receptivity

detailed_description.textblock:
A favorable uterine medium is necessary for embryo implantation, but endometrial receptivity can be negatively affected by ovarian stimulation . Study of endometrial receptivity is especially limited in the context of IVF cycles .
Biopsy of the endometrium cannot be considered during the treatment, and this has encouraged the development and use of ultrasonography and Doppler-like non-invasive methods to evaluate ovarian response to the stimulation and uterine receptivity .

primary_outcome.measure: The number of patients who will have positive pregnancy rate
primary_outcome.description: patients who will get pregnant in ICSI cycle with measuring their doppler indices before ovum pick up

intervention.description: Transvaginal Ultrasound with doppler study on endometrium will be made

study_pop.textblock: 120 patients will be included in the study whom will meet the inclusion criteria.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Maternal age from 20 to 40 years. Women with BMI range from 20 - 35 Women diagnosed with primary infertility
Exclusion Criteria:
Maternal chronic medical disorder (diabetes mellitus or hypertension). Women diagnosed with autoimmune diseases or antiphospholipid syndrome

eligibility.gender_description: infertile women who will undergo ICSI

overall_official.affiliation: Algazeerah hospital -Location (Giza -Egypt ) and National Research centre egypt
